attributes.comment:
As an adoptive parent of 2 internationally born children, I find myself in awe that
the fees are proposed to be increased yet again. And not just by a little bit, but
by an amount that far surpasses the rate of inflation. Many of these documents
(and fingerprinting) are time sensitive which causes families to reapply in a large
majority of instances. Families are being punished for the timelines of other
countries - over which none of us have any control.

I think the US Government needs to seriously reconsider raising those fees,
especially by such an absurb amount, for adoptive families. Or extend the
expiration date to a time frame that better matches what is going on with the
timelines in other countries for processing dossiers so families only have to file
once.

Building healthy, loving families ought to be the priority - not more money for
someone's pocket!
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Sue Boyd
